definition: a gift by will especially of money or other personal property : bequest
examples: She left us a legacy of a million dollars.

definition: something transmitted by or received from an ancestor or predecessor or from the past
examples: the legacy of the ancient philosophers
The war left a legacy of pain and suffering.

definition: a candidate for membership in an organization (such as a school or fraternal order) who is given special status because of a familial relationship to a member
examples: Legacies, or children of alumni, are three times more likely to be accepted to Harvard than other high school graduates with the same (sometimes better) scores …

definition: of, relating to, or being a previous or outdated computer system
of, relating to, associated with, or carried over from an earlier time, technology, business, etc.
examples: And it is about more than just TV—newspapers, magazines, radio, all the "legacy" media are feeling the earth move beneath them. Journalists look out and see thousands of empty campus TV lounges and newsprint-less recycling bins and millions of iPads and smart phones and they wonder what's coming next.

Following ISG's takeover, 100,000 Bethlehem retirees and their dependents also lost their medical coverage, and they will get only a fraction of their original pension benefits. Avoiding those expenses, known as legacy costs, will save ISG more than $400 million a year.
